name: Christmas Cobbler
author: mama calandri
summary: This Christmas cobbler is a festive combo of apples and cranberries in a spice sauce covered with an oatmeal cookie-flavored crunchy topping! Yummy stuff! Serve with vanilla ice cream.
ingredients: 2 cups sweetened dried cranberries (such as Craisins®)
1 ½ cups butter, cubed, at room temperature
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix baking mix, milk, and white sugar together in a bowl until it reaches a cake batter-like consistency
Mix apple pie filling, sweetened dried cranberries, and apple juice together in another bowl
Combine oats, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl
Mix in butter to a crumbly texture with some unmixed butter chunks
Pour baking mix mixture into the prepared pan until half full
Add fruit mixture and spread out from the center
Bake in the preheated oven until starting to brown, about 45 minutes
Remove from the oven and sprinkle topping over cobbler while hot
Return to the oven and bake until browned, about 15 minutes more
